instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00840-a fans goes crazy after water damage
threads.message:
Hi, 


got this board with liquid damage. After all repairs were done and it booted all was ok except that fan start to spin for 2-3 seconds with very high revolutions and than stop. Do it 4-5 times and than fan stops. Every time fan start to spin it spin max. revolucion than stop spin, stop, spin stop,. 


I already checked all R4800 Q4800 zone and it all is ok. 


Any idea?

threads.title: 820-00840-a fans goes crazy after water damage
threads.message:
I bet you still have something corroded.
Run HWMonitor and look at temps too.

threads.title: 820-00840-a fans goes crazy after water damage
threads.message:
right, it was some corrosion under some components. Just putted it in ultrasonic for 1 more hour and now fan is ok, but trackpad sometimes stack. Checked trackpad and seems to be ok.


P.S. tried new trackpad and new flex and same. Onboard connector is ok and seems that Volts arriving also are ok. As the issue is "sometimes happenning" i cant find what exactly make trackpad fail. THe only thing i noticed is that when i close the macbook and it sleeps, after wake up about 20-30 second trackpad stuck and work, after that 30 seconds it's all ok.

threads.title: 820-00840-a fans goes crazy after water damage
threads.message:
Check SMC_LID_LEFT/RIGHT and LID_OPEN signals.
Possible corrosion around U5255...

threads.title: 820-00840-a fans goes crazy after water damage
threads.message: SMC_LID left 0V right 3.4V. LID OPEN 3.4 too. LID LEFT must be 3.4 too?

threads.title: 820-00840-a fans goes crazy after water damage
threads.message:
Also installed HWmonitor and Airport proximity is 128C and Mainboard Proximity 128C, too Stable, all other values are movin up down, except theese two.

P.S. it's not only trackpad whole system freezes for few miliseconds than start working normal. Will try reinstalling Mojave.

threads.title: 820-00840-a fans goes crazy after water damage
threads.message:
SMC_LID_LEFT should be high too.
Check HALL_SENSOR_LEFT at J5250.
Be sure R5253 is good.

threads.title: 820-00840-a fans goes crazy after water damage
threads.message:
All ok now. It repair itself:S. 


Will check next hours and if nothing will mark it as solved.
